name: Tokyo's Towering Population
title: Largest Urban Population
description: In 2024, Tokyo's population reached a staggering 37,115,035, making it the largest city in the world by population.

name: Debt Mountain
title: Highest Central Government Debt
description: Japan's central government debt stood at 1,210,168,100,000,000 yen in 2022, accounting for 216.21% of its GDP, the highest in the world.

name: Credit Champions
title: Leading in Domestic Credit
description: In 2023, Japan's financial sector provided domestic credit amounting to 380.17% of its GDP, the highest globally.

name: Investment Magnet
title: Top Foreign Direct Investment
description: Japan attracted a net foreign direct investment of $170.58 billion in 2023, showcasing its strong global economic ties.

name: Elderly Society
title: High Elderly Population
description: In 2023, 7.18% of Japan's female population and 6.87% of its male population were aged 70-74, reflecting a significant elderly demographic.

name: Education Excellence
title: Near-Perfect School Progression
description: In 2016, Japan achieved a 99.99% progression rate to secondary school, highlighting its commitment to education.

name: Income from Afar
title: Top Net Primary Income
description: In 2023, Japan's net primary income from abroad was $257.89 billion, indicating strong international financial engagements.

name: Government's Heavy Hand
title: High Claims on Central Government
description: In 2023, claims on Japan's central government were 145.55% of GDP, reflecting significant government involvement in the economy.

name: Low Borrowing Costs
title: Lowest Lending Interest Rates
description: In 2017, Japan boasted one of the lowest lending interest rates globally at just 0.994%, making borrowing more affordable for businesses and individuals.

name: Youth on Track
title: Lowest Youth Unemployment and Inactivity
description: Japan had one of the lowest shares of youth not in education, employment, or training, with only 3.14% of the youth population affected in 2019 and a projected 3.121% in 2024.

name: Affordable Imports
title: Low Tariffs on Manufactured Goods
description: In 2021, Japan maintained a simple mean bound rate of 2.49% on manufactured products, promoting affordable imports and international trade.

name: Competitive Currency
title: Low Real Effective Exchange Rate
description: As of 2023, Japan's real effective exchange rate index stood at 58.11, indicating a competitive currency that can boost exports by making Japanese goods cheaper abroad.

name: Modest Employee Compensation
title: Low Employee Compensation as Expense
description: In 2022, compensation of employees accounted for only 4.90% of Japan's total expenses, reflecting efficient labor cost management.
